author: cryptopetz
title: Beacon of Cardano GameFi
description: CNFTs and on-chain gaming are underrepresented at blockchain industry events, leading passionate people in our industry to overlook Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0: Overall, I believe that this proposal should serve the challenge setting well, as it gives me a well-crafted description of the actions to be taken in this project. It’s quite reassuring to know that the team covers a wide working range of Cardano-related knowledge and also shares the passion for Cardano amongst one another, so it makes sense that they’re the right people for this project. I’m personally in favor of the plans they have in mind to lure in more users from Ethereum, and the ones they use to retain them in Cardano, especially the open-source JavaScript utility package, which, if exactly as advertised, will undoubtedly fulfill its purpose. I must say I love the dedication of the team, as illustrated through the willingness to travel to crypto conferences to simply spread the words about Cardano. The proposal is also able to put forward 3 pressing problems in 3 respective aspects, though from what I’ve seen, apparently only one of them is getting a viable resolution. Therefore, I cannot give a full rating
f6_assessments.q1: From the plan and timeline presented in this section, I am with high confidence that this project will very well be likely to achieve its desired outcome, and the total number of requested budget seems reasonable, given that it is proportionally allocated to each factor of the plan. And I particularly like the LinkedIn profiles attached to their respective team members, and for a closer verification, there is also an affiliated link that covers all aspects of the team.
f6_assessments.q2: For one thing, the envisioned success does contain figures for the metrics used to measure the outcome, all of which I find to be relevant and closely related to the objective of bringing Cardano into the lives of more users (though it may seem like the project benefits more than Cardano itself). As for the development progress tracking section, however, it’s basically the same thing as the envisioned success, but without the figures. I can’t argue whether this is effective to prove their point or not, but I could certainly prefer that the proposer included perhaps the utilization of tracking tools to not only keep pace with the process more conveniently, but also enable the public to join in on the process as well.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is extremely well-written and informative, which gives an effective solution to address this problem. This project will accelerate Carnado’s growth thanks to the creative measure to solve these concerns. By thinking of many risks and challenges during conducting the project, it is straightforward to get rid of factors preventing successful implementation. However, I would like to suggest that the authors should come up with feasible solutions for each risk mentioned. In conclusion, this proposal is pretty commendable.
f6_assessments.q1: I have high compliments in terms of feasibility, which is a detailed and well-researched section. I personally like how the authors have organized the budget for each event, it is appropriate and well-specified. Team members have managed to assemble a very diverse set of skills and experience across a wide range of disciplines. Referrals on Linkedln were provided, so experience can be verified from that perspective. Regarding feasibility, the authors did an excellent job on the budget description, and well- described the team members.
f6_assessments.q2: The timeframe, milestones, and key performance indicators (KPIs) offered are clear and well thought out. This project will be easily tracked and audited by the community, and the proposers will be able to offer documentation and confirmation of completion. The GitHub offered, as well as the promise to document and disclose all actions undertaken, will be an excellent resource for producing public documentation of completed work and effect

f6_assessments.q0: The team in this proposal really want to focus on Cardano awareness. Im not entirely convinced that a team of 5, traveling around to different events are really focused on Migration, with respect to their cryptopetz project and potentially marketing this front. The word "Ethereum" turns up 6 times in their introductory section and the word "EVM" turns up zero times, which leads me to believe this is more of a promotional budget and a small amount of "Cardano centric" education.. but not entirely directed at existing Ethereum users.
f6_assessments.q1: The team have a lot of experience in marketing and promotion. I do believe they would be able to promote their product(s). But question alignment.
f6_assessments.q2: Here i would like to see a little richer metrics on how many users they are managing to bring to the Cardano space. i.e, what would be a an idea is: in their education, provide a new user that sets up a wallet with a small NFT, this would be VERY easy to query on the blockchain against the policy and then a wallet address and gauge how much that wallet has interacted with the ecosystem (just an idea). This team is good at NFT's.. they could easily implement this into their education section.

f6_assessments.q0:
Following the Covid-19 shutdown and restrictions there was less and less exhibition and conferences. However now the tide has shifted and we are more and more looking and having face value and learning on new spaces. 
The owners of this proposal are targeting to visit 5-6 major USA exhibitions related to cypto (bitcoin ETH etc...) where they will put a booth and hand out gif bags, More importantly awareness and collaboration. 
The face value of this effort and visibility will allow for existing crypto enthusiast to get more awareness of Cardano and get answered or learn about the benefit of our great ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The temembers propose that 5 people with a booth visit these 6 different exhibitions. Their input in ranking NFTs and P2E viral games will attract a large audience. 
Finally they will only expense 60% of the budget using the catalyst fund money and the rest will be funded from their business. 
Some of the budget will go tot material handouts and booth reservation / travel and other expenses related to the visits of these large exhibitions. 
I feel the enthusiasm and numbr of followers this group has is proof that their knwoledge and fandom will draw a crowd. Rest only to put in the time and effort to show up and put up the booth and have fun with the crowds!
f6_assessments.q2: Auditiing this project will require a tracking of the 6 exhibitions and confirming their attendance. In addition the handout material nd booth registration will be invoices and traceble. Finally it is important to note that the project will only be funded 60% using the catalyst fund and the rest will be provided by the group members.

f6_assessments.q0: They want to promote CNFTs and GameFi at crypto industry events. They will also create educational material and an open-source JavaScript toolkit. As a gamer, I think that GameFi can bring a lot of new people to the Cardano ecosystem, especially from Ethereum. The low fees of Cardano will give it a huge advantage, but I don't think the Ethereum gaming community is aware of what's coming to Cardano, so there needs to be a push to spread awareness.
f6_assessments.q1: Detailed timeline of conferences, educational material and development. They are only asking for 60% of costs. Linkedin profiles of members. The CryptoPetz team have done a great job so far at building a community around their up coming game. I think they would be great Cardano ambassadors.
f6_assessments.q2: Such metrics as the number of conferences attended allow for easy auditability. The criteria for success is measurable.

solution: Attend these events as CNFT & GameFi ambassadors, and assist in educating communities about the technical benefits when building on Cardano.
experience: CryptoPetz advocated participation in CNFTs & GameFi at industry events like: Bitcoin Conference, The Cardano Summit, NFT NYC, and Art Basel last year, meanwhile facilitating person to person discussions regarding key concepts of Cardano, like staking, by way of Gamification.
